container.heading: Petitions for Adoption, Amendment, or Repeal of Regulations

para.text: In this chapter, the following words have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
"Department" means the Maryland Department of Health.
"Petition" means a petition to promulgate, amend, or repeal a regulation.
"Regulation" has the same meaning as stated in State Government Article, §10-101(e), Annotated Code of Maryland.
"Secretary" means the Secretary of Health.

section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to all petitions submitted to the Department to promulgate, amend, or repeal a regulation over which the Secretary has rulemaking authority.

section.heading: Who May File.
section.text: Any interested person may file a petition requesting the promulgation, amendment, or repeal of any regulation over which the Secretary has rulemaking authority.

section.heading: Form.
section.text: A petition may be in any written form chosen by the petitioner, and shall include:

para.text: A detailed description of the regulation which the petitioner requests the Department to promulgate, amend, or repeal;
A statement in support of the petition; and
The name, address, and telephone number of the petitioner.

section.heading: Submission.
section.text: The petition should be addressed to the Regulations Coordinator, Herbert R. O'Conor Building, 201 West Preston Street, Baltimore, Maryland 21201. Petitions will be considered submitted upon receipt in the office of the Regulations Coordinator.

section.heading: Disposition.
section.text: Within 60 days after receipt of a petition, the Secretary shall either deny the petition, stating in writing the reasons for denial, or initiate rulemaking proceedings.

section.heading: Reasons for Denial of a Petition.
section.text: The Secretary may deny a petition to promulgate, amend, or repeal a regulation, for any reason permitted by law, including, but not limited to:

para.text: That the Secretary does not have the authority to grant the petition;
That the Department does not have adequate information or resources to evaluate the petition;
That the Department does not have adequate resources to implement the requested regulation if it is adopted;

That the Secretary previously adopted a regulation dealing with the same subject matter as that of the petition and rejected the position taken by petitioner at that time, or the petitioner unreasonably failed to make his position known at that time; or
That the requested regulation change is contrary to or inconsistent with Departmental policy.
Rulemaking proceedings may include any type of action which the Secretary is authorized or required by law to take when promulgating, amending, or repealing regulations, including:
Studies to gather information concerning the regulation;
Advance notice of proposed rulemaking if the Secretary determines that additional information or public comment is necessary or desirable before a proposed regulation can be formulated;
Referral to advisory councils or other official or quasi-official agencies or groups responsible for reviewing the regulation;
Proposal of the regulation in the Maryland Register;
Reproposal of the regulation if the Secretary determines that, before final adoption, the proposed regulation needs to be altered and that it is substantially different from its original text;
Modification of the regulation change either in form or in substance, and either before or after proposal in the Maryland Register, to better reflect the Secretary's responsibilities.
Despite the initiation of rulemaking proceedings, the Secretary may decide not to promulgate, amend, or repeal the regulation.

section.heading: Notice to the Petitioner and Other Persons.
section.text: The Secretary shall send written notice to the petitioner and any other person requesting notification as follows:

para.text: If the petition is denied, the Secretary shall send written notice of the denial, including the reasons for the denial, within 60 days of receipt of the petition.
When the regulation appears in the Maryland Register, the Secretary shall send notice of this event at the time of the appearance in the Maryland Register.

When the Secretary finally disposes of the requested regulation by final promulgation, amendment, repeal, or a decision to discontinue the rulemaking, the Secretary shall send notice at this time. If the final disposition is a decision to discontinue the rulemaking, the notice shall include a statement of the reasons for the discontinuance.

section.heading: Files of Petitions for Regulations.
section.text: The Department shall maintain a file of all petitions submitted and their disposition. This file shall be available for public inspection as provided in State Government Article, §§10-611—10-630, Annotated Code of Maryland.
